com.google.code.ssm.spring
Class ExtendedSSMCacheManager

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.cache.support.AbstractCacheManager
      com.google.code.ssm.spring.SSMCacheManager
          com.google.code.ssm.spring.ExtendedSSMCacheManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.cache.CacheManager
public class ExtendedSSMCacheManager
extends SSMCacheManager

CacheManager backed by a Simple Spring Memcached (SSM) Cache. Spring Cache and CacheManager doesn't support configuring expiration time per method (there is no dedicated parameter in cache annotation to pass expiration). This extension of SSMCacheManager overcomes this limitation and allow to pass expiration time as a part of cache name. To define custom expiration on method as a cache name use concatenation of specific cache name, separator and expiration e.g. 

 public class UserDAO {
 
     // cache name: userCache, expiration: 300s
     @Cacheable("userCache#300")
     public User getUser(String name) {
 
     }
 }

Since:
3.0.0
Author:
Jakub Bia≈Çek
